Usage Examples¶

Command line usage¶

Index some directories¶

To index you Documents and Pictures folder recursively:

metaindex index -r -i ~/Documents ~/Pictures

Reindex all files¶

To only update the metadata from all known files:

metaindex index -i

Find all files¶

List all files that are in cache:

metaindex find

Find file by mimetype¶

Searching for all image/* mimetypes can be accomplished by this:

metaindex find mimetype:^image/

Listing metadata¶

To list all metadata tags and values of all odt files:

metaindex find -t -- "filename:odt$"

List the resolutions of all files that have the resolution metadata tag:

metaindex find -t resolution -- "resolution?"

Developer examples¶

Index some files¶

You can use metaindexer’s index facility without using the cache:

 1"""How to index some files using metaindex"""
 2import sys
 3from pathlib import Path
 4
 5import metaindex
 6
 7
 8def index_files(files):
 9    """Just run the indexer on these files"""
10    # we need at least the basic configuration
11    config = metaindex.Configuration()
12
13    # if you actually want to also load the user's config file/preferences,
14    # do this instead:
15    #   import metaindex.configuration
16    #   config = metaindex.configuration.load()
17
18    # find and load all additional humanizers and indexers
19    config.load_addons()
20
21    # loads the extra mimetypes from the configuration, if there are any
22    config.load_mimetypes()
23
24    results = metaindex.index_files(files, config)
25    # index_files returns a list of each one IndexerResult per file
26    assert all(isinstance(r, metaindex.IndexerResult) for r in results)
27
28    # return the CacheEntry per IndexerResult (i.e. per file), but only if
29    # that file's index run was successful
30    return [result.info
31            for result in results
32            if result.success]
33
34
35if __name__ == '__main__':
36    # run the indexer on all files that were provided as commandline parameters
37    userfiles = [Path(p) for p in sys.argv[1:]]
38    print(index_files(userfiles))
